definitions.definition: a man who is polite and well educated, who has excellent manners and always behaves well

examples.text: You acted like a true gentleman.
He was always the perfect gentleman.
He was too much of a gentleman to ask them for any money.

definitions.definition: used to address or refer to a man, especially somebody you do not know

examples.text: **Ladies and gentlemen!** Can I have your attention, please?
She was talking to an elderly gentleman.
Ladies and gentlemen of the jury!
There's a gentleman to see you.

definitions.definition: used to address or refer to a male member of a legislature, for example the House of Representatives
a man from a high social class, especially one who does not need to work

examples.text: He retired to his estate and lived the life of a country gentleman.
a gentleman farmer *(= one who owns a farm for pleasure, not as his main job)*

definitions.definition: a man/woman who does not have to work

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘man of noble birth’): from gentle + man, translating Old French gentilz hom. In later use the term denoted ‘a man of a good family (especially one entitled to a coat of arms) but not of the nobility’.
